docs.snippet: Donald Trump's determination to recast the role of government has a whiff of Reaganism, and his plays on divisions are reminiscent of Richard Nixon, a historian says. But many Americans have a simpler assessment of the opening days of the new admi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's determination to recast the role of government has a whiff of Reaganism, and his plays on divisions are reminiscent of Richard Nixon, a historian says. But many Americans have a simpler assessment of the opening days of the new administration's governing-by-upheaval: It's unsettling, even to some who voted for the shake-up that Trump promised.

headline.main: Amid Trump's Shake-Up, Many Wondering 'What's Coming Next'
headline.print_headline: Amid Trump's Shake-Up, Many Wondering 'What's Coming Next'
